Commentary Text: Neesham to du Plessis, 2 runs, a direct hit at the striker's end, is du Plessis short of his ground? He was scampering across, think he's definitely short, but did de Kock actually break the stumps before the ball came to him? Looked like a direct hit from one angle, but it wasn't. The bails have definitely lit up before the ball arrived, but was the second bail still intact? The third umpire has a couple of looks, there's some confusion - de Kock thinks he's got his man, but Gaffaney wants to have a few more looks and he says "Stop, stop.. I haven't given it out." Looks like the decision was displayed on the big screen before the third ump made a call, which is why QdK was celebrating and Faf walked off. He was then stopped. NOT OUT is the call. Lucky escape for du Plessis, was definitely short, but de Kock had dislodged one bail before collecting the ball. Faf managed to poke his bat just inside the line before the other bail was ignited. Faf was coming for a second run after tucking one past mid-wicket - a rocket throw from Surya Kumar, right besides the stumps and du Plessis was always struggling
